briefdescription.para: chunks are automagically created as soon as they are referenced

detaileddescription.para: terrain meta data
maps chunk coordinates to chunks.
returns a list of all referenced chunks

fill the terrain with given terrain_id values.
whether the data filled on the terrain was cut because of the terrains size limit.
Attach a chunk to the terrain, to a given position.

parameterdescription.para: The chunk position where the chunk will be placed
Was this chunk created manually? If true, it will not be free'd automatically

detaileddescription.para: get a terrain chunk by a given chunk position.

simplesect.para: the chunk if exists, nullptr else

detaileddescription.para: get a terrain chunk by a given tile position.

simplesect.para: the chunk it exists, nullptr else

detaileddescription.para: get or create a terrain chunk for a given chunk position.
get or create a terrain chunk for a given tile position.
return tile data for the given position.
the only reason the chunks exist, is because of this data.
an object which contains the given point, null otherwise
get the neighbor chunks of a given chunk.
chunk neighbor ids: 0 / <- ne 7 1 6 @ 2 5 3 4 \ <- se

parameterdescription.para: the position of the center chunk.

detaileddescription.para: return the subtexture offset id for a given tile position. the maximum offset is determined by the atlas size.
this function returns always the right value, so that neighbor tiles of the same terrain (like grass-grass) are matching (without blendomatic). -> e.g. grass only map.
checks the creation state and premissions of a given tile position.
checks whether the given tile position is allowed to exist on this terrain.
validate whether the given terrain id is available.
validate whether the given mask id is available.
return the blending priority for a given terrain id.
return the blending mode/blendomatic mask set for a given terrain id.
get the terrain texture for a given terrain id.
get the blendomatic mask with the given mask id.
return the blending mode id for two given neighbor ids.

draw the currently visible terrain area on screen.
engine
the engine where the terrain should be drawn to.

memberdef.argsstring: (const coord::tile &ab, const coord::tile &cd, const coord::tile &ef, const coord::tile &gh, bool blending_enabled)
memberdef.name: create_draw_advice

detaileddescription.para: create the drawing instruction data.
created draw data according to the given tile boundaries.

simplesect.para: a drawing instruction struct that contains all information for rendering

detaileddescription.para: create rendering and blending information for a single tile on the terrain.
gather neighbors of a given base tile.

parameterdescription.para: the base position, around which the neighbors will be fetched
the destination buffer where the neighbors will be stored
influence buffer that is reset in the same step

detaileddescription.para: look at neighbor tiles around the base_tile, and store the influence bits.

parameterdescription.para: the base tile for which influences are calculated
influences will be stored to this buffer, as bitmasks

simplesect.para: an influence group that describes the maximum 8 possible influences on the base_tile

detaileddescription.para: calculate blending masks for a given tile position.

parameterdescription.para: the base tile position, for which the masks are calculated
the buffer where the created drawing layers will be stored in
the buffer where calculated influences were stored to

detaileddescription.para: the terrain class is the main top-management interface for dealing with cost-benefit analysis to maximize company profits.
actually this is just the entrypoint and container for the terrain chunks.
